verses.plain: Why, seeing times are not hidden from the Almighty, do they that know him not see his days?

tokens.t: Why, seeing times are not hidden from the Almighty, do they that know him not see his days?

verses.plain: Some remove the landmarks; they violently take away flocks, and feed thereof.

tokens.t: remove the landmarks; they violently take away flocks, and feed

verses.plain: They drive away the ass of the fatherless, they take the widow’s ox for a pledge.

tokens.t: They drive away the ass of the fatherless, they take the widow’s ox for a pledge.

verses.plain: They turn the needy out of the way: the poor of the earth hide themselves together.

tokens.t: They turn the needy out of the way: the poor of the earth hide themselves together.

verses.plain: Behold, as wild asses in the desert, go they forth to their work; rising betimes for a prey: the wilderness yieldeth food for them and for their children.

tokens.t: Behold,
wild asses in the desert, go they forth to their work; rising betimes for a prey: the wilderness
food for them
for
children.

verses.plain: They reap every one his corn in the field: and they gather the vintage of the wicked.

tokens.t: They reap
his corn in the field: and they gather the vintage of the wicked.

verses.plain: They cause the naked to lodge without clothing, that they have no covering in the cold.

tokens.t: They cause the naked to lodge without clothing, that
no covering in the cold.

verses.plain: They are wet with the showers of the mountains, and embrace the rock for want of a shelter.

tokens.t: They are wet with the showers of the mountains, and embrace the rock for want of a shelter.

verses.plain: They pluck the fatherless from the breast, and take a pledge of the poor.

tokens.t: They pluck the fatherless from the breast, and take a pledge of the poor.

verses.plain: They cause him to go naked without clothing, and they take away the sheaf from the hungry;

tokens.t: They cause
to go naked without clothing, and they take away the sheaf
the hungry;

verses.plain: Which make oil within their walls, and tread their winepresses, and suffer thirst.

tokens.t: make oil within their walls,
tread
winepresses, and suffer thirst.

verses.plain: Men groan from out of the city, and the soul of the wounded crieth out: yet God layeth not folly to them.

tokens.t: Men groan from out of the city, and the soul of the wounded crieth out: yet God layeth not folly

verses.plain: They are of those that rebel against the light; they know not the ways thereof, nor abide in the paths thereof.

tokens.t: They are of those that rebel against the light; they know not the ways thereof, nor abide in the paths thereof.

verses.plain: The murderer rising with the light killeth the poor and needy, and in the night is as a thief.

tokens.t: The murderer rising with the light killeth the poor and needy, and in the night is as a thief.

verses.plain: The eye also of the adulterer waiteth for the twilight, saying, No eye shall see me: and disguiseth his face.

tokens.t: The eye also of the adulterer waiteth for the twilight, saying, No eye shall see me: and disguiseth
face.

verses.plain: In the dark they dig through houses, which they had marked for themselves in the daytime: they know not the light.

tokens.t: In the dark they dig through houses,
they had marked for themselves in the daytime: they know not the light.

verses.plain: For the morning is to them even as the shadow of death: if one know them, they are in the terrors of the shadow of death.

tokens.t: For the morning
to them even as the shadow of death: if
know
the terrors of the shadow of death.

verses.plain: He is swift as the waters; their portion is cursed in the earth: he beholdeth not the way of the vineyards.

tokens.t: He
swift as the waters; their portion is cursed in the earth: he beholdeth not the way of the vineyards.

verses.plain: Drought and heat consume the snow waters: so doth the grave those which have sinned.

tokens.t: Drought and heat consume the snow waters:
the grave
have sinned.

verses.plain: The womb shall forget him; the worm shall feed sweetly on him; he shall be no more remembered; and wickedness shall be broken as a tree.

tokens.t: The womb shall forget him; the worm shall feed sweetly on him; he shall be no more remembered; and wickedness shall be broken as a tree.

verses.plain: He evil entreateth the barren that beareth not: and doeth not good to the widow.

tokens.t: He evil entreateth the barren
beareth not: and doeth not good to the widow.

verses.plain: He draweth also the mighty with his power: he riseth up, and no man is sure of life.

tokens.t: He draweth also the mighty with his power: he riseth up, and no
is sure of life.

verses.plain: Though it be given him to be in safety, whereon he resteth; yet his eyes are upon their ways.

tokens.t: it be given him
in safety, whereon he resteth; yet his eyes
upon their ways.

verses.plain: They are exalted for a little while, but are gone and brought low; they are taken out of the way as all other, and cut off as the tops of the ears of corn.

tokens.t: They are exalted for a little while, but are gone and brought low; they are taken out of the way as all
, and cut off as the tops of the ears of corn.

verses.plain: And if it be not so now, who will make me a liar, and make my speech nothing worth?

tokens.t: And if
not
now, who will make me a liar, and make my speech nothing worth?

footnotes.text: corn: Heb. mingled corn, or, dredge
they gather…: Heb. the wicked gather the vintage
disguiseth…: Heb. setteth his face in secret
no…: or, he trusteth not his own life
